headline: Artificial Intelligence Helps Predict Natural Disasters
lead: Of the event. An earlier study showed predictive abilities that could help mitigate disasters, including preventing tornadoes from occurring How technology helps us survive emergencies - it's already helping to save lives! We've long known this but now we have an example showing how tech is changing our survival skills with real-world examples demonstrating its impact on humans too. In 2007, scientists at MIT were developing software designed specifically so they would be able forecast disaster scenarios by studying what was happening around them ... They used artificial intelligence -- not human experts nor even computer models like those involved in such early predictions today.

full_article:
Of the event. An earlier study showed predictive abilities that could help mitigate disasters, including preventing tornadoes from occurring How technology helps us survive emergencies - it's already helping to save lives! We've long known this but now we have an example showing how tech is changing our survival skills with real-world examples demonstrating its impact on humans too. In 2007, scientists at MIT were developing software designed specifically so they would be able forecast disaster scenarios by studying what was happening around them ... They used artificial intelligence -- not human experts nor even computer models like those involved in such early predictions today.

I've also used the concept of "Ceasefire" as an acronym for something along these lines:.

And finally…The US-led media and its allies are calling for Israel's ouster after the Israeli election victory in November 2016 of President Donald Trump who has been accused (and dismissed) as far more anti Semitic than Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz or Democratic Party nominee Hillary Clinton . "Trump is an enemy to Jews everywhere," said Dan Glickman from National Review Online , adding: "the Jewish state should be destroyed." These attacks on America have gone largely unreported but it appears all eyes are now fixed firmly upon Jerusalem because just two days ago Netanyahu issued his first official statement since taking.

"Early warning systems save lives and property," Dr. Yuki Tanaka, Seismology expert, commented on the situation.

, or (1) A scientific paper published in an academic journal with no peer-review process where authors write up their findings and submit them to other researchers without further review; these scientists are then presented as having achieved success independently of any formal validation procedure - i .e., they have not been asked to replicate what others did but instead try out new methods using data from previous experiments only if there is compelling evidence against it , e..g.: "In this study, [the author] found.
